definition: divine light (around the Buddha)/a halo/a miraculous column of light/(slang) jolly good!

sentences.english: You know how we always have those ‘aha’ moments in the shower?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們總在洗澡時靈光一現？

sentences.english: These are the creatures that provided Darwin with the flash of imagination that led to his theory of evolution.
sentences.chinese: 這也是讓達爾文靈光一現，想到了進化論的生物。

sentences.english: That was a light-bulb moment for me.
sentences.chinese: 那對我真是一個靈光的時刻。

sentences.english: His latest novel came to him while sitting in traffic in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的小說是在坐車時突發奇想，靈光閃現。

sentences.english: Bursts of mental clarity can be sudden and unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 靈光乍現可能會是突然發生的並且難以預測的。

sentences.english: He bore upon his brow the indescribable reflection of a light which was invisible.
sentences.chinese: 他額上反映出靈光，那是我們看不見的。

sentences.english: All you need is to set up a little plan and bring some light in.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要指定一個很小的計劃，靈光一現。

sentences.english: Instead, each advertiser has had its own little eureka moment.
sentences.chinese: 其實，每個廣告人都有那靈光一現的時刻。

sentences.english: He Emmanuel a move, so out of a couplet.
sentences.chinese: 他靈光一動，一副對聯就這樣出來了。

sentences.english: Helfrich says a light went off in his head as soon as he saw the patient.
sentences.chinese: 海爾銳遲說，他看到患者的一剎那，腦中靈光一現。

sentences.english: It is here, in this quiet moment, that you have an epiphany.
sentences.chinese: 就是在此時此地，你感受到了靈光頓悟。

sentences.english: A light bulb just went on. I'd suddenly remembered something the teacher said in class.
sentences.chinese: 我靈光乍現，突然想起老師在課堂上說過的一個東西。
啊哈，靈光一閃，眼控手機就有了。

sentences.english: There's no shortage of great ideas and no shortage of people willing to give it a go . . . for a while.
sentences.chinese: 總會有靈光一現的想法和人，在那一刻願意放手一博。

sentences.english: Blankness, digs out the light from heart.

sentences.chinese: 此時斯圖爾特靈光一閃。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons
